Defines

#define DEVID   0x00
#define THRESH_TAP   0x1D
#define OFSX   0x1E
#define OFSY   0x1F
#define OFSZ   0x20
#define DUR   0x21
#define LATENT   0x22
#define WINDOW   0x23
#define THRESH_ACT   0x24
#define THRESH_INACT   0x25
#define TIME_INACT   0x26
#define ACT_INACT_CTL   0x27
#define THRESH_FF   0x28
#define TIME_FF   0x29
#define TAP_AXES   0x2A
#define ACT_TAP_STATUS   0x2B
#define BW_RATE   0x2C
#define POWER_CTL   0x2D
#define INT_ENABLE   0x2E
#define INT_MAP   0x2F
#define INT_SOURCE   0x30
#define DATA_FORMAT   0x31
#define DATAX0   0x32
#define DATAX1   0x33
#define DATAY0   0x34
#define DATAY1   0x35
#define DATAZ0   0x36
#define DATAZ1   0x37
#define FIFO_CTL   0x38
#define FIFO_STATUS   0x39
#define ADXL_MB   0x40
#define ADXL_R   0x80
#define ADXL_W   0x00
#define X_OFF   0xFF
#define Y_OFF   0xFA
#define Z_OFF   0x06

Function Documentation

void ADXL_CalAngle ( float *  acc_g,
float *  angel 
)

Calculates the angel based on the accelerometer values.

Parameters:
*acc_gpointer to the acc values converted in "G-forces"
*angelpointer to the buffer for the calculated angels This function calculates the angle based on a few application notes on the internet it make use of <math.h> for atan...
Todo:
implement faster and smaller atan() function
void ADXL_Convert_to_G ( int16_t *  acc,
float *  acc_g 
)

Converts the raw values to G forces.

Parameters:
*accpointer to the buffer which holds the accelerometer values
@acc_gpointer to the buffer for the converted values This function brings the raw values of the sensor to real world units
void ADXL_GetACC ( int16_t *  acc )

returns the accelerometer values

Parameters:
*accpointer to the buffer for the acc values Reads all 3 axis and stores them at the adress of [acc] acc[0] = x acc[1] = y acc[2] = z
uint8_t ADXL_ReadByte ( uint8_t  reg )

Reads a single byte from the SPI interface.

Parameters:
regthe register to read
Returns:
byte the value from the register Reads a single byte from the ADXL. CS and interrupt handling are all done by this function!
void ADXL_ReadSeq ( uint8_t  reg,
uint8_t *  data,
uint8_t  count 
)

Reads a sequence of bytes from the SPI interface.

Parameters:
regthe register to read
*datapointer to the buffer
countnumber of bytes to read Reads a complete byte sequence of the length [count] from the ADXL the bytes are stored at the adress of [data]
ErrorStatus ADXL_SPI_Setup ( void   )

ADXL Setup Initialize GPIOs and SPI for SPI1 inclusive GPIOC_14 and GPIO_15 for interrupt handling Initial values for the sennsor are hardcoded ! -> :(.

Returns:
ERROR = 0, SUCCESS = !ERROR... this check is based on reading the DEVID.
Todo:
implementing interrupt handler
void ADXL_Write ( uint8_t  reg,
uint8_t  byte 
)

Write a single byte on the SPI interface.

Parameters:
regthe register to write
bytethe byte to write Writes a single byte on the SPI interface to the ADXL. CS and interrupt handling are all done by this function!
